body_html: @nairouz You can leverage tf.GradientTape() where all operations are recorded in order to compute the gradients of any tensor computed within the context. You can customize this function any way you want. This should not block you from using high-level Keras API.

body: @nairouz You can leverage tf.GradientTape() where all operations are recorded in order to compute the gradients of any tensor computed within the context. You can customize this function any way you want. This should not block you from using high-level Keras API.
